page.title: 14Farming in Moy
page.content: The farm is the Estate Farm. The Farm Manager lives in the Farm house. The Dairy is now an office. A self_employed joiner works in a small part of the steading. The farm employs few people nowadays. In the last fourteen years people have left the area due to lack of work. The farm has mainly cattle and sheep, providing calves and lambs for market. The main crop is grass for grazing, silage and hay. Other crops are rape and roots. No grain is grown nowadays. Crops are now gathered mechanically. One very encouraging aspect is the attention now being paid to the farm. A new steading has been erected, fences have been repaired and large areas of marshland have been reclaimed.
